Identification_Area.title: The Plasma Experiment for Planetary Exploration (PEPE) for Deep Space 1

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references.
Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference

Instrument.name: The Plasma Experiment for Planetary Exploration (PEPE) for Deep Space 1
Instrument.description: The Plasma Experiment for Plantary Exploration (PEPE) was designed to be a general-purpose plasma sensor capable of measuring electrons and mass-resolved ions over most of particle phase space, from 8 eV to 33,500 eV. PEPE was designed with a electrostatically scanned field-of-view (FOV) that covered a solid angle of 2.8 pi steradians once each 65 seconds. The PEPE experiment included a time-of-flight spectrometer.
